title: New ranked players' starting mmr
body:
As i understand new ranked players start with ~silver mmr then climb / fall from there. (This may not be the case any more - I'm not sure).

Why not start new ranked at b5 to climb up? That way anyone who is good will climb, and anyone who is not good wont be dead weight for those working hard in silver.

replies.body: I guess low silver is considered average. So it makes more sence to me to start at average and go from there.
I think it makes way more sense to start at the bottom and move up from there.

> I think it makes way more sense to start at the bottom and move up from there.

Each to their own i guess :^)

At the moment it feels like that you guys don't care about the Bronze and Silver plebs.

DO YOU GUYS REALLY THINK THIS SHIT IS FAIR TOWARDS A VETERAN PLAYER LIKE ME????? ( I know I am only Silver 5...)

Lacie110 EUW player which is lvl 31 unranked player and has only started playing ranked games now, I understand that the MMR is higher than mine atm and that is why the player was added to my game which I understand but this is bullshit!

I think you guys should rather group players of the same lvl or players that have been playing since season 3 like myself. I am not saying that I should be ranked in masters tier but I would like to be put in the same league as myself, where the adc doesn't have 30 cs by 20 min... This is really frustrating to me and I KNOW that there are so many other players who feel like I do. I have invested so much time into this game by reading, watching, learning and game experience to be ranked with such new players?

THAT IS WHY I CANT GET OUT OF SILVER, IS BECAUSE YOUR RANKING SYSTEM IS UP TO SHIT!

PLEASE FIX IT ASAP!!!!

Thanks and sorry for shouting and being rude, I am so annoyed and frustrated with this that I really think you guys should try and fix this issue.

PS. If I am the only player that feels this way, I will then apologize and just never play again because then I am the shit one?! ( I hope not )

The way I see it, it's Riot's way of saying "Silver is normal, if you are Bronze you're a monkey".

Most games give you an "average" level when you start new account. Overwatch, Halo etc give you the average starting MMR and let your play decide if it falls or rises.

The games where you start from the bottom and move up are usually single player games. Hearthstone, FIFA etc where you can't complain about "stuck in elo hell" because if you can't beat shitters, since the game is 100% on you, then you are a shitter.

Your placement games have such an impact, where you "start" is largely irrelevant. If you don't belong in Bronze, you will have no problem climbing. Similarly, the lack of decay in Gold/Silver is an incentive for "dead weight" to not play.  The people who complain about ranked tend to want immediate results, and the system doesn't work like that. The more you play, the more accurate your ranking is. :)
It depends how you go in placements though. I started ranked too soon and went 0-10 and got put in b4
